intro: Dichrotrichum chalmersii, commonly known as the Chalmers' dichrotrichum, is a species of flowering plant in the family Poaceae. It is a perennial grass that typically grows in moist, well-drained soils, often found in wetlands and along stream banks. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in spikelets. It is characterized by its ability to thrive in wet environments and its potential use in ecological restoration projects. Its botanical features make it an important component of wetland ecosystems.
